body.head: Gustav Wustmann (born Dresden, May 23, 1844; died Leipzig, Dec 22, 1911)

div.p: Gustav Wustmann (born Dresden, May 23, 1844; died Leipzig, Dec 22, 1911), German philologist and historian.

Author of books on Leipzig, its history, architecture, and painting, his most famous work is Allerhand Sprachdummheiten: Kleine deutsche Grammatik des Zweifelhaften, des Falschen und des Hässlichen [A Great Many Language Stupidities: Short German Grammar of the Dubious, the False, and the Hideous] (1891, 4/1908), which aroused much opposition.
